the anti-pasta was excellent , especially the calamari , as were the filling pasta mains .
but when you are seated the waitresses are great , they explain everything on the menu , and the price of the food is really cheap for the service you get .
the octopus eaters were floored by the octopus salad .
all the appetizers and salads were fabulous , the steak was mouth watering and the pasta was delicious !!!
the service was fast and friendly and the food was very tasty and they had the best hot sauce to add to your meals .

but they 've done a really nice job of offering all the typical pizzeria faves plus some terrific specials like the godmother pizza ( a sort of traditional flat pizza with an olive oil-brushed crust and less tomato sauce than usual ) .
decor is nice though service can be spotty .
the decor in this place is very diner-ish and the kind of place you expect in the east village - not romantic , just simple , small and sparse .
this is the best secret place in midtown ' , i heard that from the bartender , after having brilliant food ( try steak with portobello mushrooms ) and drinks on the bar last tuesday .
we decided to eat in tea room which was small and cute .
our agreed favorite is the orrechiete with sausage and chicken ( usually the waiters are kind enough to split the dish in half so you get to sample both meats ) .
interesting selection , good wines , service fine , fun decor .
service is friendly , and never had a problem walking in and getting a table .
taj mahal offeres gret value and great food .
the pizza is delicious - they use fresh mozzarella instead of the cheap , frozen , shredded cheese common to most pizzaria 's .
the food is yummy , especially their cooked-to-perfection mussels in spicy tomato sauce and their shoestring crispy fries .
it might have been a little too spicy for my friend , which you can couteract with eat more rice and keeping water on hand .
as soon as my father lifted his pen from the check a chef appeared to usher us out .
believe us , we 've been eating sushi for over 15 yrs .
oh yes , and they lie on the phone , claiming they have seating in the garden , then of course the seats are not available .
the halibut was too salty , dessert was so so ( do n't waste any of your calories ) and service was poor .
the dosas are skimpy , unattractive and drip with grease , and personally i 'd drink popcorn topping before i 'd eat another one of these .
the bread and lamb chops i had before the meal were quite good , however .
also make sure you pay attention to the music being piped in - quite a weird selection .
we came here on a crowded saturday night and were seated right away despite being 15 minutes late for our reservation .
the food is reliable and the price is moderate .
once for dinner and once for brunch .
having not been home in the last 2 years may skew this reviewer a bit , but the food was tasty and spicy sans the oil that comes floating along at similar venues .
the soup for the udon was soy sauce and water .
tried the pad see ew on the recommendation of the last reviewer since it 's one of my favorite dishes .
i ordered the chu chu curry and my friend ordered the pad thai chicken .
were meeting up with some friends for a drink at lafayette 161 and happened to walk by thai angel famished .
it 's like they took leftover chicken , poured oil and sprinkled pepper powder over it ( the sauce was translucent and red ) .
a few tips : skip the turnip cake , roast pork buns and egg custards .
it costs $ 2 extra to turn a regular roll into an inside-out roll , but the roll more than triples in size , and that 's not just from the rice .
of course this atmosphere is lacking , but what do you expect from a 24 hour bagel place anyways ?

they did not have mayonnaise , forgot our toast , left out ingredients ( ie cheese in an omelet ) , below hot temperatures and the bacon was so over cooked it crumbled on the plate when you touched it .

i had the cod with paella ( spicy and very filling , i 'm a big eater and could only eat half ) while my boyfriend had the classic fish and chips ( again , a big serving - at least 5 pieces of fish and a basketful of fries ) .
because of the delicate thin crust , take-out pies get soggy in their boxes .
this place does n't compare with mamoun 's in terms of price , freshness , value , and consisent quality , but that 's just my opinion .
but the thai is definitely not great -- bland and indistinguished .
the singapore mai fun had no curry flavor whatsoever .
for the people who want great food plus great service , roxy is a place to avoid !
the entree was bland and small , dessert was not inspired .
first of all , this place is * not * romantic , as claimed by citysearch 's editorial review .
we ordered the special , grilled branzino , that was so infused with bone , it was difficult to eat .
if you 're craving for haru 's great food , especially the house roll , but ca n't stand the wait building outisde , head across the street to their sake bar !
